Looks like a use of the term 'validation' in the question and the 'correct answer' are inconsistent with the definitions given in PMI guide:
Validation. The assurance that a product, service or system meets the needs of the customer and other identified stakeholders. It often involves acceptance and suitability with external customers. Contrast with Verification.

Verification. The evaluation of whether or not a product, service or system complies with a gerulation, requirement, specification, or imposed condition. It is often an internal process.

questions.question_text: A major stakeholder wants to know how the implementation of new features in the development of a product is progressing. Which of the following should be reported to the stakeholder?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Requirements status shall show the status of the Requirements.

The status can be tracked any Requirement management software or even in traceability matrix

Selected Answer: C
The requirements status during the project development cycle provides a clear picture of how new features are progressing. It tracks the movement of requirements through different stages—such as defined, approved, in development, tested, and implemented—giving stakeholders real-time insights into the implementation process.

Selected Answer: C
C. Tracing requirements would have helped determine this issue before delivery. Tracing requirements is the process of linking project objectives to the specific requirements that are needed to achieve those objectives. By tracing requirements, the business analyst can ensure that all of the project objectives have associated requirements, and that those requirements are clearly defined and understood. This can help identify any gaps or missing requirements that may have been overlooked during the planning process.
